org.jasig.cas.util

Class PseudoTransactionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager
      • org.jasig.cas.util.PseudoTransactionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.springframework.transaction.PlatformTransactionManager

    public class PseudoTransactionManager
extends org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager
    This is a PseudoTransactionManager, borrowed from spring-integration-core that serves as a mock NOOP transaction manager. An implementation of PlatformTransactionManager that provides transaction-like semantics to sources that are not inherently transactional. It does not make such sources transactional; rather, it provides the ability to synchronize operations after a flow completes, via beforeCommit, afterCommit and afterRollback operations.
    Since:
    4.2.4
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
